Articles.Content:
I have this feeling that Kerbin is neglected, and it's one of the objects with the most developed surface.

Post photos (be reasonable, no full res wallpapers, use thumbnails or web resolution, it's looks horrible and without order) of your favorite and nicest places you've seen or would like to explore.

Few days ago I was retrieving a satellite from a very eccentrical high orbit and I've discovered there's an actual lagoon on it. It's low on details because my PC is not powerful and I prefer normal framerate over looks.

I don't use MechJeb and I've recovered the landed capsule so there are no coordinates, but I do have a snapshot of Kerbin for reference.

It's rather far from KSC, close to the polar cap.

Unfortunatelly, I landed few kilometres away so walking towards it quickly became a stupid idea. I wonder how deep the water is.

My future plan is to visit one of the river sources on Kerbin.

My favorite place is where the desert meets the grassland. I like the color of the grass there.

Edited October 4, 2013 by fatfluffycat
There's some interesting coastline north of KSC. I need to rebuild my Buzzbomb and take a spin around the planet...
Does anyone know what the area Harv described as "badlands" in the post on Kerbin biomes looks like?

Took this a while ago:

The mountains a couple of continents east of KSC.
